item.title: Generating JVM memory dumps from JRE
item.description: Generating JVM memory dumps from JRE on Linux/Windows/OSX Generating a JVM heap memory dump with JDK is straightforward as almost every Java developer knows about jmap and jcmd tools that come with the JDK. But what about JRE? Some people think you need JDK, or at least part of it, but that’s not true. The answer lies in jattach, a tool to send commands to JVM via Dynamic Attach mechanism created by JVM hacker Andrei Pangin (@AndreiPangin).
